intro: Pedicularis siphonantha var. typica, commonly known as the slender beard vetch, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, often in moist, shaded habitats. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are adapted for pollination by insects such as bees and flies. The species is notable for its specialized morphology and ecological niche within its native range.
